task.title: Creating an Event
task.abstract: The Events object is the primary configuration object for the full details of an event, regardless of the Registration Style.

step.cmd: Navigate to the Events tab from the Events app and click the New button in the Recent Events related list.
step.info: Use the Events related list on the Event Category record to easily store, access, and configure the details for subsequent events.

step.cmd: Enter the Event Name and the Display Name.
step.info: The Display Name is viewable on the Events Search page in the Community Portal.

Link the new event to a previously created Event Category. If left unpopulated, the Event Category will default to Uncategorized. The Status field's default is set to Planned; do not alter the predefined values of Planned and Active.

info.b: Change the Status picklist to Active to enable backend and Community Portal registration.

step.cmd: Enter the Ticket Sales Start Date, Time Zone, and Event Key.
step.info: The Event Key is a unique identifier that differentiates the different item classes created for the event.

step.cmd: Enter the hex values for the ETicket Label Color and ETicket Value Color.
step.info: The ETicket Label Color controls the font color of the label on the Passbook. The ETicket Value Color controls the color of the field value.

li.b: Start Date, Start Time, Start Date/Time
End Date, End Time, End Date/Time

ul.li: Registration Style - Autopopulated based on the values entered on the Event Category record.
Guest Registrant Field Sets (CSV) - This field must be populated when registering additional attendees. Applies to Conference Style events only.
Registration Instructions - Autopopulated based on the values entered on the Event Category record.

Calendar Reminder Text - When a customer clicks the Add to Calendar link on an event, the details entered into the Calendar Reminder Text field compose the body of the calendar item. The Event Name, Start Time, End Time, and Venue information are included by default. Applies to Simple Events only.

Email Notification Text - Enter the text that is the body of the email attendees receive upon initial registration. The Event Name, Start Time, End Time, and Venue information are included in the email by default.

step.cmd: Enable any additional Advanced Options that are required for the event:

ul.li: If Waitlisting is enabled, enter a value for the Capacity field.

Define the fields used for sorting ticket types displayed on the Event Registration page in the Community Portal by entering the full API name in the Ticket Type Sort Field. Best practices recommend sorting on Name and Price. Defaults to Name.
Define the display order of the ticket types, ascending or descending, via the Ticket Type Sort Order field. Defaults to ASC.
Enable Registration Groups to allow authenticated users to register additional attendees. Applies to Conference Style events only.

Enable Access Permissions to prevent displaying the event to users in the Community Portal without the required Badge.Ticket Type Sort Field and Ticket Type Sort Order must be populated to create a new event. For previously created events, Ticket Type Sort Field and Ticket Type Sort Order are only required upon editing the Event record. Additionally, Schedule Items and Sponsor Sales are available for Conference Style events only and must be enabled prior to saving the Event record to autocreate the related item classes.

step.cmd: Populate the Event Site Detail fields; the fields will map directly to the pages in the Community Portal.

ul.li: Thumbnail Image URL-Displays on the Events Search page. For Conference style events, the Thumbnail Image URL will also display along with the Agenda Builder on the Event Detail page.
Image URL-Displays as the banner image on the Event Registration page in the Community Portal.
Overview HTML-Provides an overview of the scheduled event and maps to the Overview tab on the sidebar nav of the Event Detail page.
Agenda HTML-Provides a description of the event's schedule items and maps to the Agenda tab on the sidebar nav of the Event Detail page. Applies to Conference Style events only.
Speakers HTML-Provides a description, or introduction, to the event's speakers and maps to the Speakers tab on the sidebar nav of the Event Detail page. Applies to Conference Style events only.
Sponsors HTML-Provides a description, or introduction, to the event's sponsors and maps to the Sponsors tab on the sidebar nav of the Event Detail page. Applies to Conference Style events only.
Venue HTML-Provides a description of the Primary Venue and directly maps to the Venues tab on the sidebar nav of the Event Detail page.
Group Manager HTML - Provides any further details for attendees of a group registration. Applies to Conference Style events only.
Schedule Item(s) Display Name - Provides shoppers guidance when selecting and adding sessions to the backend Shopping Cart. Applies to Conference Style events only.

step.cmd: Check the Is Published checkbox to publish the event in the Community Portal and click Save.

taskbody.result: Creating a new event will automatically generate Assignment Roles and a Ticket Type Item Class. If Schedule Items and Sponsor Sales are enabled, a Schedule Item Item Class and Sponsor Item Class are also created upon saving the new Event record. Additionally, Related Lists autopopulate with the configurations set on the Event Category record.
